Word by word meaning..

ğŸµJana            = People
ğŸµGana            = Group
ğŸµMana           = Mind
ğŸµAdhinayaka= Leader
ğŸµJaya He      = Victory 
ğŸµBharata       = India
ğŸµBhagya       = Destiny
ğŸµVidhata      = Disposer
ğŸµPunjaba     = Punjab
ğŸµSindhu       = Indus
ğŸµGujarata    = Gujarat
ğŸµMaratha    = Marathi Maharashtra
ğŸµDravida      = South
ğŸµUtkala        = Orissa
ğŸµBanga        = Bengal
ğŸµVindhya     =Vindhyas
ğŸµHimachal   =Himalay
ğŸµYamuna     = Yamuna
ğŸµGanga        = Ganges
ğŸµUchchhala = Moving
ğŸµJaladhi      = Ocean
ğŸµTaranga    = Waves
ğŸµTava          = Your
ğŸµShubh    =Auspicious
ğŸµNaame = name
ğŸµJage     = Awaken
ğŸµTava     = Your
ğŸµShubha      = Auspicious
ğŸµAashisha = Blessings
ğŸµMaage     = Ask
ğŸµGaahe      = Sing
ğŸµTava        = Your
ğŸµJaya        = Victory
ğŸµGatha      = Song
ğŸµJana       = People
ğŸµGana      = Group
ğŸµMangala = Fortune
ğŸµDayaka   = Giver
ğŸµJay He    = Victory Be
ğŸµBharata  = India
ğŸµBhagya  = Destiny
ğŸµVidhata = Dispenser
ğŸŒ¸Jay He, Jay He, Jay He, Jay Jay Jay Jay He = Victory, Victory, Victory, Victory Forever...

03/08/2019, 7:12 pm - +91 90165 38357: Hey guys,
We've been hearing a lot about ISRO lately. 
ISRO's successful satellite missions and various other cutting edge space projects have made the organisation a national treasure. All ISRO satellite launches are associated with abbreviations like PSLV, GSLV and INSAT. Ever wondered what they mean ? Being a prospective engineer, have you ever been curious about how ISRO communicates with its satellites or how they produce such efficient rockets at relatively low costs ? If you have, here's your chance to learn and discover more at the *_"Talk on ISRO"_* event, presented by *Aavishkara*

08/08/2019, 12:31 am - +91 90165 38357: *SPICMACAY- ASEB Chapter* 
 
 *SPIC MACAY* introduces traditional Indian culture to the youth of this country with the hope that the wealth of knowledge, wisdom and beauty that it encompasses will become an integral part of their lives. Classical Indian music and dance, carrying with them generations of wisdom, are the chief mediums for creating a cultural awareness amongst young, energetic volunteers. 
We welcome all cultural affectionate lovers to be a part of this cultural extravaganza and to promote an awareness of the rich and heterogeneous cultural tapestry amongst the youth of our country.

For further details please contact:

*ACROM & IEEE RAS* is hosting it's third and most looked-forward-to event of the semester, *'Basic Hands-on Robotics Workshop'*.

âœ“The pace at which Robotics is growing is at a different level today! 
âœ“This workshop is introduced to smoothen your journey in the field of robotics and to promote robotics right from the grass roots. 
âœ“It consists of fundamental concepts of basic electronics, coding, mechanics and it's various applications in real time with practical exposure! 
âœ“You will be taught to build, code and run 5 types of bots from scratch. They include,
~*Line Follower bot*
~*Edge Detector bot*
~*Sumo wrestling bot*
~*RC controlled bot*
~*Object Detecting bot*

30/08/2019, 7:30 pm - +91 90141 69344: *Periodical Test 1 - 19CUL101 - Cultural Education - 1*

Dear students,

As announced in the class, the PT1 will consist of 50 MCQs - each with *one* correct answer only. You will have questions based on Assertion and Reasoning, True or False, Passage Comprehension, etc.
Correct answer will carry +1 mark and wrong answer will be negatively marked. The magnitude of the negative marking will be revealed on the day of the exam

Kindly make sure you are able to log in to your AUMS *today* (Log in and password - both will be your Registration Number). If you are unable to log in, don't panic and don't go meeting faculty/ ICTS people for help. *Just inform your CR in case you can't log in*. The CRs can inform their respective Cultural Education faculty.

Cultural Education Faculty
Arjun Bharadwaj - Sections B, H
Manish Walvekar - Sections G, I, C
Nibedita Banerjee - Sections E, F, A
Pranshu Samdarshi - Section D


Syllabus for T1

As informed in the classes, *everything* that is taught in the class will be included for T1.

(Please note that there can be some difference in the topics covered for different sections. Thus, *25% of the questions that appear in T1 will be section specific*)

The topics include
1. Puruá¹£Ärtha-s
2. Vará¹‡ÄÅ›rama-dharma-s
3. Meaning of College prayer
4. Aryan Invasion Theory, Sindhu-Sarasvati civilization (if taught in your section)
5. PÄá¹‡ini (if taught in your section)
6. The three states - Wakefulness, Dream, Deep Sleep - AvasthÄtraya (if taught in your section)

This is a reading material for *Puruá¹£Ärtha-s*
https://www.prekshaa.in/hinduism-series-sanatana-dharma-scratch

We will be using *IAST through out*. Make sure you understand the *notation and diacritical marks*

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Alphabet_of_Sanskrit_Transliteration
In addition, the following are to be studied *on your own*
1. First two chapters of Wings of Fire (i.e., until page 26 of the pdf/ page 22 of the printed book)
2. Until *page 9* of Cultural Education text book given to you
3. Read newspapers *everyday* - there will be some questions on current affairs
4. General knowledge about India (states, capital cities, languages, etc)


If you have paid attention to things taught in the class, the *T1 will be really easy.*

14/09/2020, 6:47 pm - +91 74065 01607: *IMPORTANT INSTRUCTIONS FOR STUDENTS FOR AUMS TESTS/QUIZZES*
(To be shared with all students)

How can students avoid problems when taking online tests?
Online testing has more variables than the traditional classroom setting and thinking about them before test time is helpful for instructors and students. Based on our testing of the AUMS system, we offer the following guidelines to ensure students can successfully complete tests and quizzes.

Open only one window and one browser
If the quiz is open in multiple tabs, browsers, or computers, your answers may be submitted incorrectly, and the test timer may be incorrect. AUMS might also temporarily close your exam and display a â€˜data discrepancyâ€™ warningâ€”forcing you to reopen the exam in only one window and browser. Revisiting old exams while taking an exam might also trigger these warnings and/or result in lost answers.

Save your answers frequently
If all the questions are on one page, the save button will be at the bottom of the page. Periodically click â€œsaveâ€ and then scroll back up to answer the questions. Click only once when saving your answer. Even if the system is slow, clicking more than once could cause further delay. If it is a linear model, once you click on next your answer will be saved. 

Use a reliable network connection when possible
If the Internet connection is lost or the browser closes unexpectedly, your answers may be lost. Avoid taking tests at locations where internet access is inconsistent.

Complete the exam promptly
Open the exam only when you are ready to complete it. Do not leave the exam open while you do other things, because you could get distracted and lose your answers before they are submitted. If your instructor has created an exam with a time limit, your answers will be submitted automatically when the timer expires.

Do not use your browser's Back and Forward buttons
This can cause problems with your assessment (answers might not be saved or could be submitted automatically). If you need to move to another question, use the Previous and Next buttons at the bottom of the screen.

You may be timed out after a certain amount of inactivity
If you are working on a quiz question and there is no interaction between you and AUMS for some amount of time, you will be logged out of the system or your test will be auto-submitted. Depending on the quiz settings, you may be prevented from accessing the test or question. Timed tests begin when you start the test and launch the timer. Even if you log out, the timer continues to track the remaining time available to complete the test.

Wait for a confirmation number
After clicking â€œSubmit for Grading,â€ wait for the submission screen that includes your Confirmation Number (depending on your connection, it may take several minutes).  If you close your browser before seeing this screen, your test may not be recorded.


NOTE: Certain security measures are applicable only for Tests and quizzes, you may not face the above issues with any other modules of AUMS.

16/09/2020, 5:42 pm - +91 74065 01607: *The Grand Typology of Whatsapp Users*

Over time, this uniquely evolving, almost-surreal cyber community has revealed a fairly discernible stratification, which I shall now attempt to document.

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

*The Iron Curtains*
These, very iron-willed, men and women have infinite tolerance and insist on zero visibility. No amount of taunting, provocation, labeling, or even threats to remove them from the group has even the slightest effect. They continue to be unmoved and invisible â€“ be it in a group, or otherwise.


*The Blackholes*
All your attempts at texting these blessed souls are merely one-way traffic. You will not get a reply even to â€œhiâ€ or â€œgood morningâ€.


*The world exists only to serve me*
These are active and frequent participants. However, a â€œGood Morningâ€ or â€œHappy New Yearâ€ or â€œHappy Diwaliâ€ from you merely gets a â€œthank youâ€ from them. They will not wish you back the same. It is quite clear that they have decided you do not deserve to have either a good morning or a happy new year or a happy Diwali, or a happy anything else!


*I have 100GB data per day*
These blessed souls have decided that along with Google, they need to increase our (apparently poor) knowledge by forwarding every audio, video, text message, and image they can lay their hands on. 
(Over time, I have figured out countermeasures, aimed at staying happily ignorant.)


*The Blue Moons*
They are most mysterious. They make their very rare appearances, with no identifiable cause or frequency. A rarer few are predictable, and respond to their birthday wishes from others.


*The Sunshiners*
They are truly the sunshine in our lives. They need no excuse to be cheerful and happy, and brighten every group, and every chat window with their presence, and an endless supply of smiles, or at least smileys. God bless them always!


*The Moonshiners*
They make it a point to come online only when you are in your weariest and sleepiest state. When you see their enthusiastic and cheerful text, you feel guilty but your eyelids and fading brain do not permit you to interact enough with them.


*The Greyscalers*
They, apparently, lack color vision, and see the world as a bleak, shapeless grey mass. No attempts at engaging in a cheery conversation have any effect. They seem to have an inbuilt disability to engage in smiles. 


*The Pranksters*
These age-indifferent youngâ€™uns with a seemingly endless bag of tricks have made it their lifeâ€™s mission, to gain immeasurable delight, out of the short term misery and pain of their victims. 


*The Debaters*
They have a gift for provoking and inciting strong emotions with their words and swords. They make the group lively, and then make the group exhausted â€“ not necessarily always in that order.


*The Diplomats*
They serve the most needed role of big brother big sister, arbitrator, and peacemaker. They are often, but not always, the group administrators. God bless their patience and good intentions!


*The Wits*
These precious ones, blessed with a quick mind and a glib tongue, truly hold sway over the group. While they can be scathing with their sarcasm at  times, they definitely keep us alert and alive!


_This is just a start. I invite other â€œresearchersâ€ to build upon this magnum opus, and freely share their findings with the world._


â€¦..
â€¦..uttik

17/09/2020, 10:36 am - +91 74065 01607: *The Label* 

Consciously avoid labelling others and ignore labels given by others.

During a prank, a student stuck a paper on his classmate's back that said *Iâ€™m stupid* ; he asked the rest of the class not to tell the boy.

Thus the students began laughing throughout the day. Shortly afterwards, mathematics class started and their professor wrote a difficult question on the board.

No one was able to answer it except the boy with the sticker. Amid the slight laughs, for he didnâ€™t know why, he walked towards the board and he solved it, the teacher asked the class to clap for him and removed the paper on his back.

He told him *It seems that you donâ€™t know about the paper on your back that one of your classmates put and the rest of them kept it a secret*

Then the teacher faced towards the rest of the class and said *Before I give you a punishment, I will tell you 2 things*: 

First, throughout your life, people will put labels on your back with many bad things written on it to stop your progress.

If he had known about the paper, he would not have gotten up to answer the question.

All you have to do in life is ignore the labels people give you and use every chance you have to progress, learn and improve yourself.

â€œThe second is that, it is clear that he does not have any loyal friends among you all to tell him about removing the paper. It does not matter how many friends you have, it is the *loyalty between you and your friends that matter*

If you don't have friends who can defend you behind your back, who can watch over you, protect you and who genuinely care about you, you are better off alone.

To the person placing the label, that word you said against the other person to one person may cause a  lifetime damage to the person.

Don't place tags on people that will destroy someone when it will not build you.

18/09/2020, 10:46 am - +91 90165 38357: Prohibited Processes settings for blocking specific processes and applications from running together with SEB.
    Preset prohibited processes covering communication, screen sharing and recording apps. Let us know if you would like to suggest applications and tools to be added to those preset prohibited processes (we need information about the software and its name and Bundle Identifier (if applicable).
    Added settings to allow to reconfigure SEB, even it is already running in a secure exam session.
    Implemented setting keys to control clearing cookies when starting/ending an exam session (examSessionClearCookiesOnStart / examSessionClearCookiesOnEnd). This can be used to keep users logged in from the previous session after an exam session was started (and SEB reconfigured with new settings).
    Added setting to enable Web Inspector (web developer tools) in Preferences/Browser (same settings key allowDeveloperConsole as in SEB for Windows 3.0. If enabled and right click isn't disabled (see Preferences/Security/Hooked Keys/Enable Right Mouse), you can right click/ctrl-left click on a web page element and open Web Inspector with 'Inspect Element'.
    Added Mac-specific settings for blocking screen shots and screen recording. The separate settings allow to run SEB correctly in parallel with some remote proctoring tools.
    Added separate Mac setting for the Private Clipboard feature.
    Added Mac-specific setting for blocking screen sharing over the network (VNC): key screenSharingMacEnforceBlocked (default: false, then the value of the existing key allowScreenSharing is used).
    Added all SEB for iOS settings in Preferences window.
    Fixed that a wrong Config Key was calculated because of specific new default settings added in a new SEB version. This was the cause why SEB 2.1.4 did not work correctly with the new SEB integration in Moodle 3.9.

29/09/2020, 8:48 pm - Kishan @amrita: RaagağŸ¼
/ËˆrÉ‘ËÉ¡É™,ËˆrÉ‘ËÉ¡É‘Ë/
(in Indian classical music) each of the six basic musical modes which express different moods in certain characteristic progressions, with more emphasis placed on some notes than others.
a piece using a particular raaga.
 
Now that is the dictionary definitionğŸ“–ğŸ˜•, but our Raaga club is all about the soul of all music ğŸ¶ğŸ¤©, whether vocal or instrumental, whether you sing with a swaramandala or play a guitar ğŸ¸or anything that brings the joyğŸ¥³ of music to people! So if you are looking for place to just chillğŸ˜ with mind blowing music, then come join usâ¤ï¸! *Find the link to the page below and make sure to follow for more updates, we will see you here, at the most fun club ever!* ğŸ¤ 
https://www.instagram.com/invites/contact/?i=6jtm7njezuvl&utm_content=juonbns

*14-10-2020*  *Wednesday*
*Object Oriented Paradigm - 19CSE204*
Unit 1
Structured to Object Oriented Approach by Examples, Object Oriented languages, Properties of Object Oriented system, UML and Object Oriented Software Development, Use case diagrams as a functional model, Identifying Objects and Representation by Object Diagram: state and behaviour, Identifying classes and CRC Cards, Simple Class using class diagram: Encapsulation, Data Hiding, Reading and Writing Objects, Class Level and Instance Level Attributes and Methods, Generalization using Class Diagram: Inheritance, Constructor and Over Riding, Visibility: Attribute, Parameter, Package, Local and Global.
Unit 2
Aggregation and Composition using Class Diagram
Java Programming till inheritance(excluding inheritance).

*15-10-2020*  *Thursday*
*Digital Electronics and Systems - 19ECE204*
1)Optimized implementation of logic function using Karnaugh-map.
    K-map (2-variable, 3-variable, 4-variable, 5-variable) SOP  and POS form.
2)Strategy for minimization 
3)Incompletely specified functions .
4)Multiple output circuits 
5)Tabular method for minimization 
6)Number System (Representation and Conversion) 
7)Unsigned number arithmetic - Half adder, full adder, Half subtractor, full subtractor, Ripple carry adder, Fast adder, Design examples 
8) Signed numbers -Signed number representation, signed number addition and subtraction using 1â€™s complement and 2â€™s complement method, Arithmetic overflow 
9)Adder/Subtractor Circuit 
10)Multiplexer -Standard multiplexers, higher level multiplexer design using lower level multiplexers, function synthesis using multiplexers.

*Program Reasoning - 19CSE205*
Chapter 3 - Function Contract
Chapter 4- - Basic Instructions and Control Structures

08/10/2020, 10:14 pm - Sukha: Sharing one message received from our Principal sir today on a group.
08/10/2020, 10:14 pm - Sukha: Normally, it is the case in every whatsapp group that a lot of members stay silent. Picture this. Suppose you walking somewhere, and you meet a friend, and looking at them you utter the words, "Good morning". Your friend simply ignores your utterance and walks away. How would you feel? Is it considered cordial? Civil? Same way, here, when some wishes "Shubhodayam/Suprabhatham/Good morning", if others don't respond, is it not like just ignoring them and walking away? I'm sure the mind will find a thousand excuses: _I was busy in the morning_, _I don't check whatsapp often_, _By the time I checked, it was afternoon/evening_, _I am not active so much in whatsapp_. These excuses are endless. First of all, there is no rule that the response should be instantaneous. Whatsapp does not impose a fine for sending a reply late. ğŸ™ŠğŸ˜› There is also the aspect of "I will reply, but I will not initiate any conversation." These excuses are just different disguised manifestations of lethargy (let's not fool ourselves).ğŸ˜›ğŸ˜›

Whether it's an epic science fiction yarn or a scene from WALL-E, robots are a source of fear or joy in many different stories! Giving a digital being a sort of a personality is a great trick for humour in any story in the digital age and therefore, *ACROM-RAS* presents to you *â€œMUSE OVER BOTSâ€* where you can use your creative writing skills and muse over these robot-themed prompts and create a futuristic story with both the fun and robotic element! Mind you, the time needed is also very less! *Remember - The funnier the entries, the higher the chances of winning prices!*

Join *ACROM-RAS* to celebrate IEEE WEEK at ASEB- an extension of 11th annual *IEEE DAY*!! ğŸ‰ _Chance to win exciting prizes worth 300/- to 500/- and 5 IEEE EXCELLENCE POINTS!!_ 


*Prompts for the event are as follows: (Choose one topic)*
1)	A secret robot society came up with a diabolical plan to destroy the Sun thus destroying the whole Solar System, and you are any one of your favourite Marvel-DC character or you can be yourself, narrate a story on how you want to save the Solar System. 
2)	The year is 2450, and the world is divided. One side is for robots, the other is for humans. You were one of the unfortunate humans born on the robot side, kept alive as a slave. How will you fight technology with technology and save your kind?
3)	If Iron Man existed, what would he do to save the world from COVID?

09/10/2020, 1:09 pm - +91 98869 91112: (CRs, To be circulated in your class groups)

Dear all,

Please take a note of these points carefully-
1. A separate MS forms link will be provided to upload your answer scripts. Resubmission will be disabled there. 

2. You have to upload your answer script in the given time. 
Your exam duration is 45 minutes. We will give you additional 10 minutes to upload your answer scripts. 
The answer scripts should be in a single PDF format. No submissions will be entertained after the end time..... I repeat no submission will be entertained after the end time. Any other mode will not be entertained. 

3. The QP of your exam will be uploaded in the 'Assignment' section of AUMS.

About your AVP exam-

1. Syllabus and paper pattern have already been circulated. Contact your CR or the concerned faculty if not received yet. 

2. I suggest to attempt each and every question. Write something that appears in your mind even if you don't know the answer perfectly. This will help you a lot. 

3. Maintain the sequence of all questions in your answer script. 

4. Contact any faculty, if you need any help or you have any doubts. We are there to help you  all.

Amrita Darshanam.

19/10/2020, 7:50 pm - +91 98869 91112: Greetings from NEAT Cell, AICTE, Ministry of Education!!


The outbreak of COVID pandemic in India has caused extreme distress to the students and is a setback to academic activity. In order to foster digital learning and support the student community across the country, Enhancement in Learning with Improvement In Skills (ELIS) portal ( http://free.aicte-india.org/ ) has been designed by AICTE NEAT Cell.

NEAT Cell had a series of discussions with many Ed-tech companies to offer advanced e-learning content for free of cost. Fortunately, many companies have come forward and offered their e-learning contents FREE OF COST to learners. Courses in the range of Rs. 200 to Rs.50000 offered as FREE OF COST to all the Indian higher education students.

NEAT cell able to offer Rs. 242 Crore worth Free Digital E-learning courses to 13.9 lakh higher education students in which 2.3 Lakhs students already finished the courses and certified.

In continuation with this journey, Now Microsoft and AICTE collaborate to provide skilling, upskilling and reskilling to students and faculty in emerging technologies such as AI, Data Science to build new technologies, Microsoft also provides 25 free Azure services and $100 Azure credit to each student

As part of this partnership, over 1526 course modules (900 unique course modules) from Microsoft will be made available to students and faculty free of cost through AICTEâ€™s free e-learning portal, ELIS. Microsoftâ€™s learning resource centre, Microsoft Learn has been integrated with the ELIS platform to provide access to personalized learning paths and resources for students, covering a broad range of technologies including AI, IOT, data science and cloud computing among others.

In this regard, it is requested to circulate this among your student and ask them to visit the following URL and avail the benefits from the courses and enhance their skills.

https://free.aicte-india.org/ms-products.php


For any clarifications, feel free to contact us.


With Warm Regards:
Buddha Chandrasekhar
Chief Coordinating Officer
All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE)

Office Landline: +91 11 29581225
Email : cconeat@aicte-india.org

website: https://aicte-india.org/

25/10/2020, 6:50 pm - Sukha: Gear up for the flagship event of FACE, and the biggest event of Amrita School of Engineering, Bengaluru Campus!
*FACE*, in collaboration with *Aykya*, presents the *10th edition* of one of Bengaluru's biggest hackathons: 
*Stay Late and Code (SLAC) 2020*!

SLAC 2020 will be an online event and will invite participation from college students across India. While SLAC 2020 aims at helping beginners get acquainted with pioneers from top companies for essentially appealing to the dormant developer within each one of them, it also aims at providing a highly competitive platform for experienced developers to showcase their mettle. 

With workshops, talks and industry experts to guide participants, SLAC 2020 is a culmination that will not only prove fruitful for seasoned programmers and talent hunters, but also provide a budding ground for beginners and enthusiastic learners.

*Dates:* 7th - 8th November (24 hours)
*Registrations:* Free

31/10/2020, 9:52 pm - +91 6362 336 608: If you are wondering what an *SIG* is-

SIG(Special Interest Groups)  is a learning group where the group members explore the field of their choice (Data Science, Web Development and Competitive Coding) with the help of a mentor guiding them through the learning path. We'd be having learning sessions, resources shared, contests and even a few assessments.

Greetings from ACM and ACM-W!

We present to you, our first event of the academic year
*Return of the SIGs*

Curious about what happens at the prestigious ACM Special Interest Groups? Join us this weekend for a fun, interactive learning session!

1) Participants will be taught the basics of Data Science, Web Development and/or Competitive Coding in the form of short workshops.
2) There will be a fun contest to test your skill set at the end of each learning session.

Uh oh Freshers.... Was that a little uhh.... Intimidating?

Don't you worry! We've got a *"Beginners' Track"* and an *"Intermediate Track"* in the competitions! Choose a track that suits you best :D

Join the *Return of the SIGs event* from the *Data Science SIG* to have a taste of what we would be doing throughout the year in case you decide to join the Special Interest Group
You would also get an idea of what all the Data Science Hype is about!!!

2. Google Meet link will be given 1 hr prior to the quiz, and you can start joining in from 5:50.
3. Google forms will be given to fill out the answers and only one person from each team should fill it and the link will be given in Google Meet chat before we begin the quiz. 
4. If your taking part as team of 2 or 3, then you can use some other medium like Discord or Teams or Whatsapp to discuss with your team-mates but only one person should fill the form.

08/11/2020, 12:43 pm - +91 98869 91112: Rashmi Maam: Exercise 1 - Read the following sentences carefully. Decide which of the words from the following best fills the blank in the sentence.   #bombastic #mince #censure #platitude #harangue #disparage  #repartee  #eloquent  #sardonic  #voluble                                                 1 Darlene found that Jonathanâ€™s remarks ________(ed) her so much that their relationship was at stake. His critical comments were unkind. 2 When he discovered the error, Chesterton lashed out at Watkins. His ________ lasted for several minutes and shocked everyone in my department! 3 ABC Paper has been polluting our river for the last 20 years and has been keeping it from the public. This is not just wrong, itâ€™s criminal. ABC Paper is guilty of unforgivable sins against the environment and against the people of our state and deserves the most severe ________. 4 Because she is so ________, she has no trouble meeting new people or talking in front of a crowd. 5 I wish Edna would be more straightforward. Sheâ€™s always ________(ing) her words, as if she is afraid she will hurt my feelings. 6 What a(n) ________ essay! It is forceful and fluent with powerful and precise word choice throughout the text. 7 Calebâ€™s reply was ________, as usual. He canâ€™t seem to say anything without mockery. 8 Titus tried to insult Isabel, but she tactfully deflected the insult with a witty ________. 9 She thought she was offering some real advice, but all she could give me was some ________(s) like â€œtomorrowâ€™s another dayâ€ and â€œgood things come to those who wait.â€ 10 How could our humble, soft-spoken president make such a ________ statement to the newcomer in the group?


 


Exercise 2 - Fill in the blanks with the right option. 1. Under the ______ of their mother, the newborn kittens knew they were protected, since any predator would have to harm their mother before it could get to them. A. aegis B. negligence C. truancy D. apostasy E. primogeniture           2. In the decade after the revolution, the new government seemed to ______ and was never quite ______ ; this period ultimately led to a second revolution in which the current ruling party took power. A. careen ... ephemeral B. fortify ... faltering C. waver ... flimsy D. coagulate ... tenable E. totter ... stable          3. Despite his ______ upbringing, Vladimir proved quite adept at navigating city life. A. urbane B. acrid C. bucolic D. cosmopolitan E. harsh                4. Macbeth received what he thought was ______prediction from three witches, but his attempts to make the auspicious portents come true tragically failed in the end. A. an ominous B. a momentous C. a lamentable D. a sinister E. a propitious         5. The clownfish eats organisms that could potentially harm the sea anemone, while the anemone provides the clownfish with a safe shelter; both organisms benefit from this ______relationship. A. docile B. disjointed C. amenable D. symbiotic E. contrary     6. Because the boy had told so many ______ tales about seeing wolves, none of the villagers believed him when he actually did see a wolf. A. fallacious B. verifiable C. scrupulous D. fictitious E. concrete

Post this for all the students to have meanings of all the words not known to them. This is a self help exercise which will be attempted in the class in a democratic way- of the students/ for the students and by the students

Deepo Me Hara Tu Paapam Sandhya Deepa Namostute

Meaning: I fold my hands before the lord, the maintainer of this creation, in the form of this light. I adore this light, which destroys all the pains resulting from my omissions and commissions.

Namah shivaya ğŸ™ğŸ»,
On the occasion of Karthika masam 2nd Monday, we all welcome you to light 9 diyas on 23/11/2020 evening and be a part of *Karthika deepochavam* ğŸª”.

How do I take part in this event and what should I do ğŸ¤”? Simple
 1) You should send us a picture of yours along with 9 diyas.
 2) Number of diyas  should be exactly 9 (kindly avoid using candles).

But this exam season, for the first time in the history of ASE-B.
*Smriti is collaborating with OnePlus SAP* to make it more interesting for everyone to showcase your hidden stories from your study desk by capturing it and showcasing them. In turn, you get a shoutout from OnePlus page! 

Here are the guidelines to be followed for the campaign:
1. Submit your entries in this google form below,
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSc2P3Ah81nrLmhCMeFK-IUOL3P02vgJQOgprvaBz644fdmIGw/viewform?usp=sf_link

2. Make sure that you upload the same photos into your instagram profile.

3. Use the hashtag #EXAMShotonOnePlus on a post of yours. (Given that your Instagram profile must be public)

4. Tag @oneplus_sap and @smriticlub on your post.

*Note: All photos must be shot on OnePlus device only*

03/12/2020, 7:13 am - +91 98869 91112: Hello, folks of CSE A and B!

As discussed with a few students, we are pleased to announce two electives for your IV Semester. You may please choose any one of them.

1.	Glimpses of Indian Polity and Economy.
This course is about understanding the current and past Indian Polity and Economy. This course deals with the basics of constitution, fundamental rights, fundamental duties, preamble, Indian polity, public administration, important cases in India and basics of Indian Economy.

This course is specifically designed for the growing young and ignited minds like you to know more about the countryâ€™s current polity.

We always encourage all Engineering students to think about the civil service examinations like IAS, IPS, IFS etc. If you look at the ratio then 60% toppers in the IAS examinations are engineers. And as an educated citizen of India, we should know about all these things irrespective of our educational background. This course will help to do a strong ground-work!

2.	The message of BhagavadgÄ«tÄ.
Several students from CSE classes are having a strong inclination towards philosophy. This course is specially made for such students to satisfy their philosophical-hunger!

The BhagavadgÄ«tÄ is a saga of Indian philosophy and moreover a very very very practical and rational book! This book should never be read after your 60s! This is the PERFECT time to understand and apply the book as a student of Engineering. So, â€˜tension nahi lene ka!â€™, if you really want to cherish and enjoy the essence of the Indian wisdom then do join the course!


Apart from these two courses, we can also offer two more electives (If we get a minimum number i.e. 10 students for each elective from CSE A+B. These courses can be run, if a total of 10 students approach Mr. Manish by 02:00 PM of 03/12/2020)

1.	Introduction to Sanskrit Language and Literature
This is all about learning Sanskrit using scientific, exciting and proper tools!

2.	Indian Classics for the Twenty-First Century
A mythology-based course! Understanding the core structure of the Indian and world mythology with the help of soooooo many stories!

These courses will be taught by the faculty of Amrita Darshanam.

Looking forward to see you in the classes!

-Manish Rajan Walvekar.

Â

From: no-reply <admin@aicte-india.org>
Sent: Wednesday, December 16, 2020 1:26 PM
To: Dr.Sasangan Ramanathan (Dean-Engineering) <sasangan@amrita.edu>
Subject: "Request to Participate in Industry-Academia Conclave under IISF 2020".
 
Dear Sir/Madam,
The Department of Science and Technology every year conducts India International Science Festival (IISF) which is a mega showcase of Science and Technology Development in the country. Every year the footfall is around 4-5 lakhs. Industry-Academia Conclave (IAC) is an event under India International Science Festival being held between 22-25 Dec 2020. The event is going to be virtual this year.
The event has Three very interesting panel discussions consisting of eminent panellists from Industry as well as from Academia. The topics are very relevant to the present situation.
You may  depute the Prof I/c of Industry Institute Interaction Cell along with one or two faculty members from your Institution for Industry Academia Conclave. The details of the program schedule is attached. Registration is totally free and can be done at https://www.scienceindiafest.org/register/ and then selecting Industry Academia Event
Another interesting part of Industry-Academia Conclave is MEGA ONLINE Quiz Competition titled â€œKaun Banega Udyogpatiâ€ for UG students of Engineering and Pharmacy. The preliminary rounds will be on 22nd & 23rd Dec and Final round will be held on 24th Dec 2020.
Quiz will be held branch wise in following disciplines
1.	Electrical                                         2. Electronics
2.	Mechanical                                      4. Civil
3.	Computer Science                            6 Metallurgy
4.	Mining                                             8. Chemical
5.	Pharmacy                                        10.Energy (Open to all branches)
A unique thing about this quiz is that the questions for the branch wise quiz have been designed by the experienced Industry persons. It will test how much is the exposure and awareness of students about the Industry standards, practices, technical aspects, general knowledge about the branch in which he is taking the quiz as well as financial aspects.
So apart from questions from academics, the main focus will be on more practical questions.
It is requested to nominate at least 10 top UG students from your Institute from different branches to take part in this quiz.
Since the questions are being set by Industry experts and not by academicians, by undertaking the quiz, the student will know what he does not know about his branch and which he ought to know.
The total Prize money is Rs. Three lakhs seventy Five Thousand. Apart from First, Second and Third Prize of Rs. 10,000. Rs. 7500 and Rs. 5000, in EVERY branch there is a consolation prize of Rs. 500 for top 30 students in that branch. The Program schedule and Quiz Brochure are enclosed for your perusal.
Students participating in this quiz are also required to be registered for Industry-Academia Conclave event under IISF 2020 using the link below. Registration is on a First come First served basis and may close on 17th Dec if sufficient registrations are received.
www.scienceindiafest.org/register
Further details regarding timings, selection procedure etc  will soon be available  www.scienceindiafest.org under Industry-Academia Conclave event
 
Reach out to us, if you have any query.               
Mr. Girish Joshi           94221 53727
Mr. Naresh Chafekar   96650 94596 
Dr. Sunil Bhat              9049800298
 
The email id where any queries can be addressed is vibhavid@gmail.com

Best regards,
Balvinder Singh

All India Council for Technical Education,
Nelson Mandela Marg, Vasant Kunj, New Delhi-110070

The course helps you  understand life through different perspectives. Poems, prose, short stories that discuss various aspects of life are read and understood through open discussions. 29/12/2020, 4:05 pm - +91 90165 38357: 19ENG230
Business Communication Course is designed to introduce the students to the prerequisites of workplace communication, and familiarize them with the various modes of workplace communication like telephone and meetings. The course consists of modules on company organization, pay structures and performance appraisal systems, telephone communication, meetings, body language, cross cultural communication, listening skills etc. The learning happens through role plays, case studies, videos and presentations. The evaluation components consist of a power point presentation, a class test, a listening test and assignments.

11/01/2021, 7:34 pm - +91 98869 91112: Follow these instructions for course registration

1. Login into AUMS
2. Click on Registration (home symbol,left hand side of homepage), select *Course registration with category*
3. Semester - *4*
     Semester Type - *Regular*
4. Select all courses, then unselect the courses which are unnecessary,for example if you choose Glimpses of Indian economy and polity, unmark the other electives offered.
Please select all courses,because you can't scroll the page , you can't see the courses listed below PRP.
5.Click on Right shift (>>)
6.click on save.

18/01/2021, 11:00 am - +91 98869 91112: Rules for Faulty ComparisonsÂ  Â 

1.Â  UseÂ -erÂ orÂ -estÂ for most adjectives with one or two syllables.

Wrong:Â  I am more lonely than she is.

Revised:Â  I am lonelier than she is.

2.Â  UseÂ moreÂ orÂ mostÂ for most adjectives with two or more syllables.

Wrong:Â  Benny is the eagerest student Ms. Johnson has.

Revised:Â  Benny is the most eager student Ms. Johnson has.

3.Â  Double comparisons occur when the degree of the modifier is changed incorrectly by adding bothÂ -erÂ and more orÂ -estÂ and most.

Wrong: Doris is more friendlier than her brother.

Revised: Doris is friendlier than her brother.

4.Â  The misuse of the superlative occurs when a comparison is made between two things or people and the superlative form is used incorrectly.

Wrong: Of the two textbooks, the oldest edition is the best.

Revised: Of the two textbooks, the older edition is better.

5.Â  The superlative is also used incorrectly when it is combined withÂ any other, meaning "only one" or withÂ all the others, thereby excluding the compared item from its category. For example, the sentence below suggests that Montreal is the largest of one city.

Unacceptable: Montreal is the largest of any other city in Canada. (Can Montreal be the largest of one city?)

Revised: Montreal is the largest of all the cities in Canada.

6.Â  Illogical comparisons occur when there is an implied comparison between two things that are not actually being compared or that cannot logically be compared.

Illogical: The interest at a loan company is higher than a bank.

Revised: The interest at a loan company is higher than that at a bank.

Revised: The interest at a loan company is higher than a bank's.

7.Â  Ambiguous comparisons occur when elliptical words (those omitted) create for the reader more than one interpretation of the sentence.

Ambiguous: I like Nancy better than you.

Revised: I like Nancy better than I like you.

Revised: I like Nancy better than you do.

8.Â  Incomplete comparisons occur when the basis of the comparison (the two categories being compared) is not explicitly stated.

Incomplete: Watching television is more interesting. (Than what?)

Revised: Watching television is more interesting than reading books.

9.Â  Omission ofÂ other,Â any, andÂ else: Do not omit the wordsÂ other,Â any, orÂ elseÂ when comparing one thing or person with a group of which it/he is a part.

Unacceptable: Joan writes better than any student in her class. (Joan is a student in the class. Does she write better than herself?)

Revised: Joan writes better than any other student in her class.

If the superlative is intended, use the following: Joan is the best writer in her class.

10.Â  Omission ofÂ as: Do not omitÂ asÂ when making a point of equal or superior
comparison usingÂ as . . . as.

Unacceptable: The University of West Florida is as large or larger than the University of North Florida.

Revised: The University of West Florida is as large as or larger than the University of North Florida.

Further, in such comparisons as the following, all one need do is omit the italicized phrase to see why the comparison is faulty.

Unacceptable: This is one of the best, if not the best, college in this country. (The problem is thatÂ one of the bestÂ requires the plural wordÂ colleges, notÂ college. Such sentences need to be rewritten.)

Revised: This is one of the best colleges in this country, if not the best.

There are multiple exciting cash prizes and awards to be won! Are you ready? 

To register your students and for more details on how to apply, visit- https://cs-coe.iisc.ac.in/skills-hub/competitions/

1. Please fill the excel sheet with required information for registering the students.
 
2. College SPOCS/ Student Project Programme (SPP) Co-ordinators are requested to share the PDF version of excel on college letterhead. 

3. Please mail the excel file and the same content on the institute's letterhead as a PDF at ops.cyseck@karnataka.gov.in. 

In case of any queries, reach out to us at mgrasb.cyseck@karnataka.gov.in

*Note:* 
1) There is no limit on number of registrations from each college
2) Last date of registration is 15-Feb-2021
3) Student registration should come on letterhead of college with excel sheet shared on our website. College SPOCs can Mail these to ops.cyseck@karnataka.gov.in
4) It is Self-pace training that can be taken at your convenience. But whoever completes the course first, will get prizes (more details is given on website)
5) There is *NO* registration fee. It is *FREE*
6) It is a Self-paced online course on " Application Security- Vulnerability Assessment" comprises 51.5 hours of learning, 13.5 hours of theory and 38 hours of hands-on exercise.
7) Course will made accessible from available from 1st to 31st march
8) Exciting prizes await the winners â€“
a) Cash prizes of Rs. 25,000, Rs. 15,000, Rs. 10,000 will be awarded to the first three winners of the Grand Challenge, along with trophies.
b) Cash prizes will be awarded to three students from each district who complete the course the earliest â€“ Prizes of Rs. 10000, Rs. 5000, Rs. 2500.
c) Trophies to top three colleges with maximum participation
*Frequently Asked Questions about March for Secure Code* 

*Registration* 

1.	Can individuals register for the course?  No, CySecK will not accept individual registrations. Students who are willing to participate need to request their college SPOCs and Student project coordinators to register students from your institution. 
2.	Eligibility criteria for students to participate ? Undergraduate and Post Graduate students who are interested in coding, irrespective of their specialisation can apply. Participation need not be limited to those who are specialising in cybersecurity.  Students from colleges across Karnataka can apply via their college SPOCs and Student Project Coordinators. 
3.	Is there a limit on number of students an institution can register? No, there is no limit on the number. 
4.	Is there any registration fee? No, this programme is absolutely FREE. 
5.	How can college SPOCs and Project Coordinators register? Please refer to this page for more details https://cs-coe.iisc.ac.in/skills-hub/competitions/. Colleges can register their interested students by filling out the details in the given excel sheet. SPOCs and PCs can then share the PDF version of the excel on the college letterhead by mailing the same to ops.cyseck@karnataka.gov.in. 
6.	What is the last date to register? 15th February, 2021 

*Course* 

1. It is a month long course, will it not conflict with students academic schedules? The course is self paced and hence, flexible. Only the weekly expert sessions are live, however these are optional. The Grand Challenge, which will be held at the end of the course, will be scheduled on a weekend. 
2. When does the course start and end? The course starts on 1st March and end on 31st March 2021. We will be sharing detailed brochure of course schedule, expert sessions and Grand Challenge with the registered participants soon. 
3. What will students receive after completion of the course? Course completion certificates and LinkedIn badges will be provided to those who complete the course. There are also cash prizes for three students from each district who complete the course earliest. 

*Queries* 
For more queries, mail us at mgrasb.cyseck@karnataka.gov.in
College SPOCs and PCs can also join our Whatsapp group http://bit.ly/marchcode
Interested students can mail for registration at r_pramod@blr.amrita.edu. send first name/ last name/department/email id/phone number

Hello There!
Greetings from JIDO Club .Let's have another mind blowing seminar this year . A seminar on *"Electrification of Automobile in INDIA"* is going to be conducted by *JIDO Club*

 When?
10th February 

Guest Speaker : Karthik R (Project leader at Toyota Kirloskar Auto Parts)

Who can join?
Anyone studying in Amrita school of engineering!!ğŸ˜

What are the Prerequisites required?
None...ğŸ¤©


Everything is fine, but what will we learn?
On *10th* Feb:

*Electric Vehicles*
Electric vehicles have way less moving parts than your conventional-fuelled car or bike. This means there is no engine oil to be flushed, air filters to be replaced or parts to be lubed. A customary battery check-up is all that is needed.

*Hybrid Vehicles*
Hybrid are those that should consume less fuel and emit less CO2 than a comparable conventional petrol or diesel-engined vehicle. 

*Fuel Cell Vehicles*
A fuel cell vehicle is an electric vehicle that uses a fuel cell, sometimes in combination with a small battery or supercapacitor, to power its onboard electric motor. Fuel cells in vehicles generate electricity generally using oxygen from the air and compressed hydrogen.

So come let's explore the future of *Electrification of Automobile in INDIA on 10th of Feb* with us !!!ğŸ¤©ğŸ¤© let's know our future!!

24/05/2021, 1:13 pm - +91 98869 91112: Tips from Adithi Narayan on Microsoft Internship Program
24/05/2021, 1:13 pm - +91 98869 91112: From: Adithi Narayan <adithin2001@gmail.com>
Sent: Sunday, May 23, 2021 11:49 AM
To: Bhaskaran Venkataraman (CIR) <v_bhaskaran@cb.amrita.edu>
Subject: Preparation and Selection for Microsoft Engage
 
What is the process for selection to Microsoft ? 
Well, since my selection was based on Engage 2020, I will talk about that. In that, we had to build a project, submit a few assignments and finally go through a series of interviews. I did not have an interview though and was selected solely based on my performance in the project, assignments and my mentor's review.

*How did you prepare for it ? What was your preparation strategy ?*

I did not prepare for this program specifically. I guess, having a good grasp of DSA , some prior experience with web development and a curious mind ready to learn is all it takes. 
You must be ready to study and bridge the gap for any requirements asked during the course of the project. For me, I had to delve a little into graphs for this.  

Though I didn't have one, I did prepare for interviews a little before joining this as it was internship season. Coding regularly is the only way to crack interviews, no matter how smart you are.

*Are there any resources/websites/tutorials/youtube videos that you would suggest for the preparation ?*

Nothing specific. Practice with Leetcode/ codesignal for interviews or if you are a competitive programmer, just continue the same.

If you have any doubts with basic web dev, I would suggest looking at the MDN docs. An awesome resource for web dev is 
https://css-tricks.com/

But rather than studying, I would recommend doing. And whenever you stumble across something you don't understand/know learn it

*How was the MCQ Test ? What was the difficulty level ? What are the areas of concentration ?*

For me the MCQ Test was very simple. But, it is from a pool and I know people who got some hard variants as well. The major focus was on DSA and about 90% of the questions were DSA based [Like dry runs, outputs, complexities, etc] A few questions were on basic ML. 

*How was the Coding Test ?*

I did not have a coding test  

*Any other tips from your end ?*

Well, I would say that keep doing what you do, be true to it and don't worry about the result.
You don't have to toil for hours. Prioritize your tasks. Smart work gives way better results than hard work. 

We were initially told that the assignments are not considered. In fact, we were told that the entire program was just for the sake of knowledge. Only at the end we were told about the recruitment part. Many people I know slacked off in the start and lost an easy opportunity. I was told that my work in the assignments and contribution in the project had me selected. So, I would ask you to work even when you are not watched ğŸ˜œ

*Also your experience with the Microsoft Mentorship Program*

It was wonderful. My mentor was actually our college alumna and she was very helpful. Being a bit on the introverted side, I had to push myself to talk, actually show my work and raise concerns. The mentors are chill people and are ready to help with everything! Just remember that they are working professionals too. So, make sure you do your research before bothering them with a query. I learnt a lot in a span of just 2 months.

A little insight about the assignments
Since the program was inclined towards artificial intelligence for us, the assignments asked us to do a little bit of research on some problems with AI. You don't have to know about any of these in advance. You will be given sufficient time and some materials to start learning about these. The assignments involved studying about a research problem and providing our insight on the same. Though Google has everything, including a paraphrasing tool, your original thoughts and insights are what matters.

I hope this is helpful. If anyone has any doubts or wishes to speak to me personally about the same, you can contact me directly.  

Regards,
Adithi Narayan
[CB.EN.U4CSE18CSE205]

 A young mind is at the stage of a civilizational beginning, when there is no compartmentalization of knowledge. For a successful career in science, the habit of questioning has to be encouraged at an early stage, in the school, in the college, much before formal research is started.

=====================================================================================================================================================
University College Dublin, Ireland - Study Abroad Program

 
Amrita Center for International Programs is pleased to announce a brand new Study Abroad Program, with University College Dublin (UCD), Ireland.

UCD, Ireland is conducting a webinar for CSE, EEE, ECE, Mechanical, Aerospace, Chemical, and Civil engineering B.Tech third-year students on July 1st, Thursday from 3:00 to 4:00 PM  IST. All the B.Tech third-year students are invited to participate in the webinar. This is an informational webinar, students can clear all the doubts they have regarding this program directly to Ms. Joanne Reilly, Program Manager, Study Abroad Program

UCD is one of Europe's leading research-intensive universities; an environment where undergraduate education, masters and Ph.D. training, research, innovation, and community engagement form a dynamic spectrum of activity. It is one of the largest and most prestigious universities that is 165 years old.

UCD is globally recognized for its excellence in teaching and learning â€“ 4 subjects are ranked in the top 50 in the world in the latest edition of the most-consulted university rankings (QS World University Ranking by Subject 2021). This quality of teaching is complemented by a high standard of support. Every incoming first year is assigned a peer mentor and there are student advisers for every program.

Webinar Details:

Title:  Study Abroad Program at University College Dublin, Ireland
Date and Time: July 1st, Thursday @ 3:00 PM IST

Speakers: 

Ms. Joanne Reilly, Program Manager - Study Abroad Program, UC Dublin 
Mr. Jamie Wells, International Student Support Manager, College of Science, UC Dublin

Information regarding:
Fees
Selection Criteria
Course Offerings
Scholarships
other details
 Platform: ZOOM

https://ucd-ie.zoom.us/j/69387816555?pwd=Vmk3SHBwS0tVdGp1aTRrcnlQY043QT09
Meeting ID: 693 8781 6555
Passcode: 731602

Pre-registration required for attending the webinar.

Students have to register through the Google link given below before June 28th by 5:00 pm
https://forms.gle/QEeWYV7n3bE1E5Y1A


Eligibility for the UCD Study Abroad Program:
Second and Third-year B. Tech students from ALL engineering departments 
CGPA 8.0 and above only
Excellent English-speaking skills
High recommendations from the department
Proactive, Independent, and able to work in teams

To know more about UCD:
https://www.ucd.ie/studyatucd/


For any questions:

Did the Mars Rover pique your curiosity to explore further into the hidden depths of our Universe? Did you ever dream of making your own Rover?

08/07/2021, 9:47 am - +91 98869 91112: For the attention of third year students:

WEBINAR - 3+1+X - B. Tech / MS At University of California, Riverside - USA 

Amrita Center for International Programs is pleased to announce 3+1+X - B. Tech + MS at University of California, RIVERSIDE, USA.

UC RIVERSIDE is conducting a webinar for all B.Tech third -year students on 14 JULY (Wednesday), from 9:30 am to 10:30 am IST. All B.Tech third -year students are invited to participate in this webinar. This is an informational webinar, students can clear all the doubts they have regarding this program directly with the UCR coordinator, Mr. Jun Wang ( jun.wang@ucr.edu). 

Students have to register through the Google link given below before July 13th, by 11 am.
https://forms.gle/R8FKfjSxKdyK67db9

ZOOM LINK to attend the program:
Time: Jul 14, 2021, Wednesday - 9:30 to 10:30 AM IST
Join Zoom Meeting
https://ucr.zoom.us/j/97283132664
Meeting ID: 972 8313 2664
 
Summary of the program:
Amrita students will be enrolled through IEP ( International Education Programs ) at UCR extension, participate in the summer program at UCR extension, and enroll in regular UCR main campus classes from Fall to Spring in a full academic year
12 credits each quarter for a total of 36 credits for one academic year. Transcript shall be provided each quarter for transfer of credits back to Amrita
For the one-year study at UCR, Amrita and UCR will make a joint selection. Students will be nominated by Amrita (after HOD recommendation) and interviewed by UCR before being admitted to the program. 
Masterâ€™s Degree: Students who meet 3.0 GPA and GRE score of 300 (or equivalent score in GMAT) are eligible for Masters at UCR in the second year.  Admission decision lies with UCR
For the Masters and PhD program â€“ the above criteria of CGPA and GRE score must be met
 Tuition is $27500 for the first year (Senior), the average tuition for MS degree is $32000/year (price may vary based on each program). Living cost is suggested at $10000 per year (differs by individual studentâ€™s actual expenditure)
Students can enroll up to 8 units of Master's level courses in their first year at UCR IEP program (  https://studentdocs.ucr.edu/registrar/UCR_Catalog_2019-2020.pdf)
Final year project is taught in a class format, and will be supervised by UC R faculty mentor (For B. Tech students )
GRE and TOEFL NOT REQUIRED to attend the program 

For any questions,
Sujatha / Reshmi / Anandi
Center for International Programs
Email: amrita.dual@gmail.com

09/07/2021, 3:38 pm - +91 98869 91112: Namah Shivaya,



If students wish to apply for revaluation of End Semester Component of theory subjects evaluated with an online exam+viva pattern, they can do by filling the application form attached and payment of the prescribed fee of Rs300/- per subject. The application is to be submitted to Exam office , mailed to dcoe@blr.amrita.edu before 14th July.2021.   

  

Note that there is no revaluation for subjects for which End Semester component was not done.

Details for Online Payment

09/07/2021, 10:29 pm - +91 98869 91112: The India Connect @ NTU, Singapore
 
Amrita Center for International Programs is pleased to announce the India Connect at NTU Office (IC@N) Program. This is a virtual programmme for 2 to 6 months for undergraduate and master level students from India. IC@N enables the students to pursue their research interest at Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU) by working under the supervision of NTU faculty.

The Nanyang Technological University, Singapore is the second oldest public autonomous research university in Singapore and is considered to be one of the top universities in the world. Ranked amongst the world's top universities by QS, NTU has been placed the world's top young university for the past seven years.

Students of this programme will work under the supervision of NTU faculty, develop a strong research interest and expertise in a given research field. Eligible students are expected to fulfil a minimum of 2 months research attachment involving research project work at NTU. Students will also receive a certificate issued by IC@N office upon completion of the programme.

Summer Term
Duration
5 months
2 months

(by 2359 hrs +8 GMT)

30 November 2021
 * Please note that the start and end dates for the programme period are fixed and must be followed strictly.
 

Eligibility:

Â·  Open to Pre-final year graduates / undergraduates who have not studied at NTU previously.
Â·  Students must possess good academic track records with CGPA 8 and above. 
Â·  Students must be pursuing their studies in an Indian University / Institute of higher learning during the period of his / her programme with NTU. (Must be a current student at their Home University during the programme period)
Â·  Students that meet the minimum requirements with scholarships, publication and programme experiences will be given preference.
Â·  Good communication skills
Â·  The final year students (UG & PG students who are graduating in 2022) can apply only for the Spring Term. 
Â·  B.Tech students who are currently in the fifth semester can apply for Spring and Summer Terms
 
Important Points:
Â·        Since NTU is a non-partner university, credits cannot be transferred
Â·        Completion certificate will be given at the end of the program.
Â·        The students should apply through ACIP. Direct applications are not valid.
Â·        All final selections will be done by NTU, Singapore. They will notify the students directly.

Hi Sir/Mam,

We would like to explore the possibility of visiting your esteemed institute for internships placements for 2021-22 for our Technology Division (Job Description and Compensation details will be shared in the following days).

 

Request you to confirm the next steps and also the best possible day slot which will be allocated to Fidelity. The online test will consist of the following sections: Programming, Coding, Algorithm, Aptitude, and English language test.

 

Eligibility Criteria: Students across all B.Tech branches can apply â€“ candidates will be shortlisted based on a CGPA cut-off upon receiving the final applicant details. 

 

We along with our campus partners (HirePro) will reach out to you to finalize the next steps.

 

About Fidelity Investments:

 

Fidelity Investments is among the most diversified financial services companies in the world offering a full range of product solutions for individual investors, employers, institutions, and intermediaries. Fidelity is a leading provider of investment management, retirement planning, portfolio guidance, brokerage, benefits outsourcing, and many other financial products.

 

FMR (Fidelity Management & Research) India is a Global In-house Center (GIC) of Fidelity, US. Headquartered in Bengaluru, where operations commenced in 2003, FMR India has another fully functional unit in Chennai. FMR India collaborates with its parent organization in strengthening Fidelityâ€™s endeavours to enable clients in achieving lifelong financial independence and peace of mind.

 

Please do let us know if you require any further information. We look forward to hearing from you.

Sent: Friday, 13 August 2021
Subject: |INFORM| LinkedIn India Site Reliability Engineering Summer Internship

 

Hi Mahesh,

 

Hope you are doing well.

17/08/2021, 10:04 am - +91 98869 91112: STUDENT EXCHANGE PROGRAMS 2022

 
Amrita Center for International Programs (ACIP) invites applications from top-performing students for the Student Exchange Program at various universities in Asia, USA and Europe. We are currently accepting applications for the (January) Spring Semester, 2022. Students have to submit their interest to the Amrita Center for International Programs before the deadline - August 26th, 2021.

A limited number of students are accepted in these universities.  Students from all campuses will be selected according to their merit and the nomination by the concerned department. Please go through the respective websites of the universities to see if relevant courses in your area of study are available. 
 
The exchange program is applicable/relevant only if you are able to find corresponding courses available at the universities. Please do a rough course mapping to see if the subjects and area of interest are offered in English at your level of education - prior to application. We prefer students with CGPA 8 and above for this program. 
 
Following are the benefits:
 
â€¢             Graduate from Amrita with International study experience
â€¢             Opportunity to interact and learn from experienced faculty abroad.
â€¢             Explore opportunities for Higher Education with funding prospects
â€¢             No Tuition Fees required to be paid at Host University
â€¢             Travel and local stay expenses will have to be borne by students (Expected to cost USD 6000/- for one semester).
 
Please send your resume to amrita.student.exchange@gmail.com. All questions can be sent to the same email address.  Please also include your HOD name and email address for reference purposes.

IMPORTANT NOTE - WE STRONGLY RECOMMEND THAT STUDENTS WHO ARE SELECTED TO GO TO ANY FOREIGN UNIVERSITY DO NOT MAKE NON REFUNDABLE TRAVEL ARRANGEMENTS UNTIL THEY HAVE ACTUALLY RECEIVED THEIR VISA.

IMPORTANT NOTE: In response to Covid-19 issue, availability of seats and mode of instruction may change based on host university's decision.

18/08/2021, 8:36 am - +91 98869 91112: Invitation for the students of Amrita School of Engineering for Bolt's All-India Innovation Challenge - 4

Greetings of the day. Previously, we invited your students to Bolt's Scholarship Program. We are overwhelmed with the number of students who answered our scholarship test. We appreciate your effort in the welfare of the students.

 

 

Based on our positive experience with Amrita School of Engineering, we are now inviting your students to participate in the fourth iteration of Bolt's Innovation Challenge. 

 

As part of this challenge, we take a few selected students from some of the prestigious colleges of India, such as Amrita School of Engineering and train them on the concepts of the IoT and ML / Web Development, which is followed by a project competition between them to choose the most innovative students from India. Please note that students from all four years of engineering are eligible to participate in the Innovation Challenge.

 

The competition will be judged by some of the experts who have worked at organizations like Amazon, Larsen & Toubro Infotech, etc. The competition will be an excellent opportunity for students to showcase their talent and skills at an All-India level.

 

 

To participate, the students will have to answer any one of the scholarship tests below:

Web Development Training Scholarship: https://info.boltiot.com/webdevelopmentscholarship
Internet of Things and Machine Learning Scholarship: https://info.boltiot.com/iotmlscholarship
 

 

What are the prizes for the students?
1st Place: Cash prize of Rs. 30,000/-

2nd Place: Cash prize of Rs. 20,000/-

3rd Place: Cash prize of Rs.10,000/-

Consolation prizes: 2 Amazon Echo Dots
 

What are the steps for Bolt's Innovation Challenge?
 

Step 1: Students will have to answer a scholarship test and qualify for the same by scoring at least 70% marks. This is a short test and will not take more than 10 minutes for the students. This ensures that they can answer it without spending much time if they have exams ongoing.

 

The selected students will be eligible to join either of Bolt's trainings at an 80% discount. We charge a small fee to cover our costs and to ensure that only interested students join the program.

 

 

To answer the scholarship, students have to visit either of the following links. They can choose to answer either of the two scholarship tests based on the training they want to take up. They could also opt for both:

Web Development Training: Scholarship link https://info.boltiot.com/webdevelopmentscholarship
Internet of Things and Machine Learning Training: Scholarship link https://info.boltiot.com/iotmlscholarship
 

Step 2: Our team of developers will train the students on the concepts of the training. Upon completion of the training, each student will be issued a certificate which can be submitted to the college/university as per the AICTE rules.

 

Step 3: The students have to build an innovative project in the area of IoT and ML or Web Development by applying the learnings of the training.

 

Step 4: The winners will be judged by engineers who have worked at prestigious organizations like Amazon, Larsen & Toubro Infotech, etc.

 

 

Why should students participate?
 

Internship opportunities: Upon training completion, students are also eligible for internship opportunities. You can get more details here: https://info.boltiot.com/internshipopportunities.
 

Certification: Upon completion of the training, the students will be issued a certificate that can be submitted to the college/university as per the AICTE rules.
 

Opportunity to build hands-on projects: As a part of the training, students will complete multiple hands-on projects, that also involve an industrial project.
 

Support to resolve queries throughout the training: In case the students are stuck at any point, we offer support via forum, email and if required, also via phone call and screen share.
 

 

Certificate for colleges and faculties:
 

Certificate for colleges: As part of this program, we will be awarding the top 3 colleges with maximum students that qualify for the final round. We will be issuing a certificate and a trophy to each of these colleges.
Certificate for faculty: A certificate of appreciation for individual faculty members who ensure 20+ applications for the Innovation Challenge from their college, for embracing remote learning, teaching and ensuring that education did not stop even during a pandemic.
Other critical points:
The option of full refund: In case the students are not happy with the training offered to them, then they can get a full refund as per the refund policy. This ensures that there is no risk for students or the faculty involved in the process. 
Lifetime access: Students can register now and start the training after the exams or at any other time.
 

Deadline to register:

The last date to avail of the scholarship and register for the Innovation Challenge is Tuesday, 24th of August 2021. Keeping this in mind, please inform your students about the scholarship and competition at the earliest.
 

Next action for faculty

We request you to forward the details of this opportunity to your students at the earliest. You may share it with them via Email, Notice Board, WhatsApp, and other channels as well. 

 

You can share the link directly on WhatsApp from here: https://info.boltiot.com/iotmlinnovationshare

 

 

We look forward to training the students of 'Amrita School of Engineering' on the concepts of the training as well as their participation in the competition. In case of any queries, please reply to this email or call us on (+91)8881197198 and dial 4 to connect to me. I will be happy to answer any questions that you may have.

 


Regards,
Yeshwant Naik,
DevOps Engineering - Bolt IoT



Scholarship link to participate: https://info.boltiot.com/trainingscholarshiplist

 

Bolt IoT (Inventrom Private Limited)

79, 11th Cross Rd, Binnamangala, Indiranagar

Bengaluru Karnataka 560038 India

1. Donâ€™t call someone more than twice continuously. If they donâ€™t pick up your call, presume they have something important to attend to;

2. Return money that you have borrowed even before the person that borrowed you remember or ask for it. It shows your integrity and character. Same goes with umbrellas, pens and lunch boxes.

3. Never order the expensive dish on the menu when someone is giving you a lunch/dinner.

4. Donâ€™t ask awkward questions like â€˜Oh so you arenâ€™t married yet?â€™ Or â€˜Donâ€™t you have kidsâ€™ or â€˜Why didnâ€™t you buy a house?â€™ Or why don't you buy a car? For Godâ€™s sake it isnâ€™t your problem;

5. Always open the door for the person coming behind you. It doesnâ€™t matter if it is a guy or a girl, senior or junior. You donâ€™t grow small by treating someone well in public;

6. If you take a taxi with a friend and he/she pays now, try paying next time;

7. Respect different shades of opinions. Remember what's 6 to you will appear 9 to someone facing you. Besides, second opinion is good for an alternative;

8. Never interrupt people talking. Allow them to pour it out. As they say, hear them all and filter them all;

9. If you tease someone, and they donâ€™t seem to enjoy it, stop it and never do it again. It encourages one to do more and it shows how appreciative you're;

10. Say â€œthank youâ€ when someone is helping you.

11. Praise publicly. Criticize privately;

12. Thereâ€™s almost never a reason to comment on someoneâ€™s weight. Just say, â€œYou look fantastic.â€ If they want to talk about losing weight, they will;

13. When someone shows you a photo on their phone, donâ€™t swipe left or right. You never know whatâ€™s next;

 14. If a colleague tells you they have a doctors' appointment, donâ€™t ask what itâ€™s for, just say "I hope youâ€™re okay". Donâ€™t put them in the uncomfortable position of having to tell you their personal illness. If they want you to know, they'll do so without your inquisitiveness;

15. Treat the cleaner with the same respect as the CEO. Nobody is impressed at how rude you can treat someone below you but people will notice if you treat them with respect;

16. If a person is speaking directly to you, staring at your phone is rude;

17. Never give advice until youâ€™re asked;

18. When meeting someone after a long time, unless they want to talk about it, donâ€™t ask them their age and salary;

19. Mind your business unless anything involves you directly - just stay out of it;

20. Remove your sunglasses if you are talking to anyone in the street. It is a sign of respect. Moreso, eye contact is as important as your speech; and

21. Never talk about your riches in the midst of the poor. Similarly, don't talk about your children in the midst of the barren.

22.After reading a good message try to say       "Thanks for the message".

We are rolling out the Applied Data Science using Python Certification Program starting next week. Attached please find the course content.

We are offering at an extremely low cost as we want more students to register and get Certified. 

Training Fee => Rs 1180 only ( Including GST )

Why do you need to attend these programs ?

It is important to learn new skills and update your knowledge on various domains. Companies are increasingly looking at how you evolve over the years. We are offering at a very reasonable cost so that more students can get benefitted.

Why Data Science is important in today's world ?

In recent years, Python, Data Science, Machine Learning, Deep learning, Big Data Analytics etc. are the emerging technologies relying mainly on data. Many companies like Google, Microsoft, IBM, Lenovo, Hacker Earth, Adobe, Qualcomm, PWC, Genpact etc. are preferring candidates having skillsets in these areas.

As per the Gartner Research on technology usage by the industries for the year 2021, Data Science related technologies are stable and creating the employment with new skillset.

Gangadhar Sir who has joined our Bengaluru Campus will be offering this course. Gangadhar Sir has extensive experience in AI/ML/DL/Data Science and has several Certifications on these technologies. He has over 12 years of teaching experience at reputed engineering colleges such as New Horizon College of Engineering.

Â 
Important Points to be noted.
Â 

HACK-E-LTH is annual event organized by GEHC DT Organization as a part of its External Focus initiatives.

Objective of this event and other external focus initiatives is to build strong collaboration with sharp minds in academia.

This year as part of HACK-E-LTH Initiative we are planning to execute a set of projects with colleges. These projects will aim to solve specific problems or try to implement certain innovative ideas in healthcare space.

GEHC has gathered problems to be solved and innovative ideas to be implemented, with special focus on digital technology enablement for businesses.

Duration of these project will be 8 weeks. Students can execute these and collaborate with mentor(s) remotely.

College leadership can pick the students themselves. Pick students with strong technical expertise, interest and ability to learn and commitment to bring results.

The value this adds to students and collegesÂ  is the exposure to actual industry problems and experience in working in industrial team to solve those.

There will be rewards and recognitions for projects well executed. All teams will be receiving the participation certificates. Top projects will be demonstrated to wider audience in GE as part of culminating events of HACK-E-LTH. There will be attractive prizes.

Colleges will need to sign NDAs as part of this engagement.

03/09/2021, 9:45 pm - +91 98869 91112: *About SMART HACKS â€“ 2021-22*
Itâ€™s a 2 phases event.

- *First Phase: An Online Programming Quiz Contest on C & C++*. 
The scores of the same shall be shared with the student and college .

The Winners of the quiz will be eligible to compete in a *National level Hackathon SMART HACKS - 2021* which will be organized at IIT Kanpur in the month of March 2022.

*Second Phase: Final phase will be Mega Finale at IIT Kanpur.*

IIT Kanpur shall host all such winners from the best of the institution across the country, who will then compete amongst themselves for a 1.25 lac prize money under various heads.
 During the finals apart from the SMART HACKS â€“ 2021-22 competition, the student will be interacting with faculty mentors along with some leading Industry professionals and startups exposing them to a new world around them. 

*Important Note*
EICT-IITK will open the Quiz link on the date 4th September'21
Given below are the steps that need to be followed by the *Participants in attempting the quiz : *-
1.Click on the browser 
2.Open the URL which we have provided to you. 
3. After it the exam portal page will appear.
4.Create an account ( at last there is an option for it)  as you are a new user so you have to create an account.
5.Check your mail to give confirmation.
6. Next, click on the C & C++ programming quiz .
7. Use your Username and the enrollment key / passkey (which we have provided) to log into the quiz.
8. Click on the attempt the quiz option. 
9.Complete the quiz .
10.After finishing the quiz submit it.
11. Log out after submitting, its the most important step to follow

Thanks for your kind attention.

21/09/2021, 2:57 pm - Sukha: *Call for Executives* 

What is quizzing?

It is not about "Who is the captain of the first ship that entered India and the name of the ship".

It is about daily life facts and information that is common, and the questions which make us explore from all possible angles to arrive at an answer.

It is also about high competitiveness between the teams and 
the team which hits the buzzer first!

Doesn't it sound exciting!!
Come join us at *The Quiz Club* to have a fascinating experience about quizzing. Grab this opportunity to be a part of the quizzing family and let's have fun quizzing!!

https://forms.gle/9rGucuJ2qRpbDsjJ8
