FACE, The Forum of Aspiring Computer Engineers at ASEB, strives to educate and give hands-on experience to computer aspirants in various fields of computer science. By organizing Hackathons, coding competitions, workshops, and much more. We nurture those who wish to learn, explore and get their hands dirty, by organizing FACE Self Interest Groups in various domains of computer science. 
This club is for the geeky ones, the passionate ones, and the daring ones who have a burning desire to explore the lengths and breaths in the field of Computer Science. 

Well, What do you get from the club?
ğŸ“€A chance to develop your management/ leadership skills, and analytical skills
ğŸ“€A place where you can learn and get hands-on experience in many computer science fields, under the guidance of experts in that domain.
ğŸ“€A chance to test your skills in fields of your interest.
ğŸ“€Geeks can interact with industry experts, faculty and alumni, and fellow students to share their experience, and build a progressive and active community.

Interns for Bangalore Chamber of Commerce and Industry (BCIC).
BCIC requires three to four interns for a period of 3 months, in the following areas :
  *   Economic Analysis with Economic Affairs Committee
  *   Ease of doing business
  *   GST experience
  *   Karnataka Manufacturing Sector
  *   Our regular publications
  *   Our regular member updates.
This can become a revolving program of internship.
The candidates will have excellent experience on working with senior professionals/academics on the range of topics and with senior Industry officials and Government officials.
BCIC  will be paying a nominal stipend and also a certificate of internship at the end of the tenure.
BCIC can look at project based or tenure based  availability. BCIC prefer interns who have background in Economics/Finance/  Management . It can extend to Technology students, should they evince keen interest. This is working on online and may be required at BCIC office.

Interested applicants will have to apply on the official website before 10 October 2021.
Applicants must also clearly indicate the area of interest.
A candidate can apply for internship only once during a financial year.
The areas of internships are agriculture, data management and analysis, economics, education or human resources development, energy sector, foreign trade or commerce, governance, health, nutrition, women and child development, and industry among others.
10/10/2021, 5:14 pm - +91 98869 91112: Namah Shivaya

Dear students,

In the spirit of continuous quality improvement for all our academic processes, please note the following changes that are effective with immediate effect. These changes are intended to streamline the processing and reduce the time for any queries, requests for approvals, requests for certificates, etc. 

    All requests and inquiries MUST originate from your official Amrita Email ID and should be sent to help@blr.amrita.edu (regardless of the subject matter) (NOTE: this replaces any other existing email IDs such as info@blr.amrita.edu, certificate@amrita.edu, admission@blr.amrita.edu, etc.). You must direct all your emails to this one single email address â€“ emails sent to other IDs will not be considered for any follow up action or response. 

    INTRANET: Please visit your new online portal intranet.blr.amrita.edu â€“ this repository will contain all the key information, documents, forms, news, circulars, and updates for Amrita School of Engineering, Bengaluru. 

I hope that you will make full and effective use of these new provisions for a more user-friendly and accessible academic experience. 


Best regards,  

Sriram Devanathan 

Principal, Amrita School of Engineering, Bengaluru

Hey everyone! One weekend down, two more to go! âœ…

*What is Inktober?*ğŸ¤”
Created by artist Jake Parker, Inktober is a month long art challenge where anyone can create a ink drawing based on the prompt for the day, and post it online! It is aimed to promote creative thinking and improve your skills.

*Forms link* - https://forms.gle/frKpJvH3KjDAqzyn6

*What's our twist to this you ask?*ğŸŒªï¸
With all the academic buzz around, we chose to conduct the challenge only over three weekends! Using any medium, show us your own take on the given prompt/theme and the best ones will be chosen as the winners for each theme. The competition is scheduled for 6 days over 3 weeks and you can submit your artwork over the week through the Google forms link attached above!

*Oct 16th (Sat) prompt/ theme: Mirror / Divide*
*Oct 17th (Sun) prompt/theme: History*
Do send in your submissions by 18th Oct, 11:59 PM for this week! The themes for the final weekend will be announced shortly, so stay tuned!

For further information, contact 9606221026 (Apoorva)

Om Namah Shivaya , 



Dear All, 



It is my delight to convey to you all, that, one of the 5 member team called c0d3_h4cki05_, of Amrita School of Engineering, Bengaluru is ranked 9th among 673 teams in Tamil CTF (held during September 26-28, 2021). 



CTF is a National Level Ethical Hacking contest organized annually by Team bi0s in association with Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham and Amrita Centre for Cyber Security. The contest is exclusively for students enrolled in an Indian university and aimed at students who have no prior exposure to computer security and also for the working professionals.  



We are proud to inform that the above said team c0d3_h4cki05_, includes Ch.J. Ramakrishna (III year ECE), D. Bharath Kalyan (III year ECE), K. Onkar Sandeep (III year EAC), Rajarshi Patra (II year CSE), Anshuman Sahoo (II year CSE) of our institution  



Please join to congratulate the team between 10.00 a.m and 10.30 a.m. on Monday 18th October 2021. We shall also hear from the team. 



Please note the faculty members handling the class in the second hour (i.e., 9.30 a.m. to 10.20 a.m.) may please wind up the class by 10 a.m. and ask the students to join the meet. Request all the faculty members also to join. 



The link to join the meet is given below 

https://bit.ly/3pbI1tS 





Looking forward for your presence.

22/10/2021, 3:26 pm - +91 98869 91112: Dear Sir/Mam,

Greetings of the dayâ€¦

A Cyber Security Hackathon is being conducted for the Indian Army by Military College of Telecommunication Engineering, Mhow and Rashtriya Raksha University with ISAC as the Knowledge Partner.

The Hackathon is extended over three months and commenced on1st October this year. The participation is open to engineering students across the country as also to Army personnel. It is expected that 100000 people will participate in this individual participation event in an online mode.

Conducted over three stages, the levels of difficulty will keep increasing through each stage. The final level will also see participants competing with each other in the fields of secure coding and exploitation of software defined radios (SDRs) and will culminate in individuals competing with each other in cyber space with real and simulated threats. The participants will need to devise and execute their strategy to beat others to Capture the Flag.

The event will also host a number of seminars, expert talks and conclaves, to focus on emerging cyber threats in the military domain and the methods of mitigation.

Rashtriya Raksha University, an Institution of National Importance under the Ministry of Home Affairs is executing the Hackathon with its knowledge partners ISAC.

There is a dedicated web portal www.sainya-ranakshetram.in which allows registration and also tracks the conduct of the event. The Indian Event Army is planning to have this as an annual event.

This event is expected to benefit a large number of students to gain experience and get an opportunity to win over INR15,00,000 as prize money.

We hope your institution will take maximum advantage of this event.

For any other clarifications, feel free to contact pan@isacindia.org and rajsm@isacindia.org .

PFA:- https://drive.google.com/file/d/1R07GEWUYwRvLUvFafROmFij-MvhEGrxA/view?usp=sharing

Dear students,

In the spirit of continuous quality improvement for all our academic processes, please note the following changes that are effective with immediate effect. These changes are intended to streamline the processing and reduce the time for any queries, requests for approvals, requests for certificates, etc. 

    All requests and inquiries MUST originate from your official Amrita Email ID and should be sent to help@blr.amrita.edu (regardless of the subject matter) (NOTE: this replaces any other existing email IDs such as info@blr.amrita.edu, certificate@amrita.edu, admission@blr.amrita.edu, etc.). You must direct all your emails to this one single email address â€“ emails sent to other IDs will not be considered for any follow up action or response. 

    INTRANET: Please visit your new online portal intranet.blr.amrita.edu â€“ this repository will contain all the key information, documents, forms, news, circulars, and updates for Amrita School of Engineering, Bengaluru. 

I hope that you will make full and effective use of these new provisions for a more user-friendly and accessible academic experience. 


Best regards,  

Sriram Devanathan

26/11/2021, 12:40 pm - +91 98869 91112: Internship opportunities on AICTE Internship Portal by Ministry of WCD and Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs for students having programing skills -reg.
26/11/2021, 12:40 pm - +91 98869 91112: Dear Sir/Mam,
Greetings of the day..
We hope this email finds you in the best of spirits in these tough times.
We are happy to inform you that the Ministry of WCD and Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs require interns those are having excellent programing skills in PhP, threeJS, JavaScript, Angular and other related. These opportunities are available on AICTE internship portal.
Internship Opportunities can be found here: 
1.	https://internship.aicte-india.org/internship-details.php?uid=INTERNSHIP_1637579876619b7c64581b4&level=4
2.	https://internship.aicte-india.org/internship-details.php?uid=INTERNSHIP_1637814094619f0f4e51235&level=4
Students of Computer science & engineering and related discipline can apply for these internship opportunities. Ministries are having numerous of projects like CARA, AMRUT etc. in which various applications are to be developed for maximum reach to end user and monitoring the regular activities.  Student having excellent programming skills on various tools can apply to these opportunities.
It is requested to share this information among your student network and ask them to register on the portal and avail the benefits.
AICTE has mandated six-month internships as a part of Model curriculum for technical institutions. AICTE Internship policy mandates a minimum of 14-20 credits of Internship activities for B. Tech. degree programmes and 10-14 credits for three-year diploma programme. This will result in about 600 to 700 hours of total internship duration for B.Tech. and 450-500 hours for Diploma students.
In this regard, it is to inform that AICTE has launched Internship Portal http://internship.aicte-india.org/ to integrate classroom knowledge and theory with practical application and skills developed in professional or community settings. This website provides the perfect platform for students to put forth their skills & desires and for companies to place the intern demand and currently 11.85 lakh vacancies are available on portal and more than 69 Lakh students are already registered.
We hope that our internship portal, which is entirely free of cost, will be helpful to your students in adapting to a transparent internship process and abundant access to real, credible and the most genuine opportunities.
For any clarifications, feel free to contact us.

With Regards,
Dr. Buddha Chandrasekhar,
Chief Coordinating Officer,
NEAT Cell,
AICTE HQs
New Delhi
011-29581423
neatsupport@aicte-india.org

Newton school,Â https://newtonschool.co, is an online computer science education founded by IIT-R and IIM-C Alumni that transforms students into full-stack developers with a solid foundation in computer science. 17/12/2021, 2:24 pm - +91 98869 91112: Dear Sir/Madam,

AICTE has launched the admissions for the GDC National Software Engineering Internship programme to identify the brightest software engineering students in India.

As of 13th December, 16,200 students across 1247 institutions in 33 states are participating in the programme that aims to select 40 students for a 13-week full scholarship training followed by six-month internships with industry. The programme is fully sponsored with no fees for students.

As this is an AICTE and Industry supported prestigious training cum internship programme, please share the attached programme brochure to students in your institutions through email and class whatsapp groups.

17/12/2021, 9:38 pm - +91 90165 38357: Let me tell you the truth about Santa Claus. If his Marx-esque appearance and red clothing werenâ€™t an immediate giveaway, I must point blank tell you: Santa is a communist.

I am sorry if I ruin your festive mood, I am sorry if you think itâ€™s blasphemy, but itâ€™s time to face the facts. Despite of what you want to believe, the world is governed by market forces and a seemingly benevolent, egalitarian creature wonâ€™t grant your wishes just because you ask nicely. So before you go wasting ink and paper writing your letter, hear me out.

Santa Is an Authoritarian
First of all, sorry to shatter your beliefs, but Santa is not benevolent. He is an authoritarian who without any rule of law arbitrarily decides who is naughty or nice. If he deems you nice, he will reward you. But if he deems you naughty, well, who knows what a powerful communist like him would do to you.

Sure, you could argue that the nicer you are, the bigger the reward, but thatâ€™s also true for a communist dictator. The closer you are to his own subjective ideal, the better you serve his own interests, the more you will get. There is no telling, however, when his fancy changes.

Santa wonâ€™t reward you on some objective merit. He favors his cronies, but he thinks everyone should get something. Each according to oneâ€™s needs.

In the spirit of a good egalitarian tradition, he disincentivizes actual accomplishments. If you keep your head low you will get something. It is unnecessary to do better. Only if you are a crony, is it worth to aim higher.

If you are not deemed as an enemy of Santa, you will receive something, donâ€™t worry.

Moreover, where do you think all those toys come from? Santa is running a sweatshop exploiting the elves, who wonâ€™t get any wagers. They are essentially slaves, who have to work, because they fear Santa. It only makes sense. Santa doesnâ€™t ask for money for what he is doing, so he himself has no income. This means he cannot pay any employees.

And what exactly is Santa doing? He knows where you live,he know what you have been doing, he spies on you, disrespecting your privacy. Santa goes into your house, disregarding private property, and forces his services on you.

In turn, as a sort of tax, he takes your milk and cookies. Will he at least give some of that to the elves? I hardly think so. He wouldnâ€™t want to incentivize slaves, now would he?

Santa: The Embodiment of the Communist Utopia
One word. All it takes is one word to show you why Santa is a communist: scarcity. The bane of all communist utopias, scarcity gives goods their value. 

Santa, however, has an infinite amount of time and resources. How else could he deliver all the toys in one night, and be able to manufacture them every single year? The toys he gives are therefore worthless. Not only are they not the rewards for actual actions, as I pointed out before, but because of the lack of scarcity they donâ€™t have value.

Ever wondered why Santa is not giving out money, only toys? Itâ€™s because if he lifted scarcity of money, it would become worthless too. This is another reason he wonâ€™t pay his elves. It would cause an inflation, which would eventually destroy the currency.

This is, therefore, the limit of Santaâ€™s power and the barrier in front of all communist utopias.

We donâ€™t have an infinite amount of everything. It is not a problem though. Scarcity creates value and incentives. It creates respect for things. It creates economics, rule of law, and social order. And it creates a demand for free markets, to transfer the scarce goods. This is what Santa would never fully understand.

The only thing that gives Santa the ability to eliminate scarcity, to exploit his slave elves, to force his services upon you, and break into your home, taking your milk and cookies, the only thing that gives him the power to arbitrarily judge you is your misguided belief in the communist utopia that is Santa.

So stop believing in Santa. Stop believing in a higher, seemingly benevolent force that you think will provide without you lifting a finger. It is time to wake up.

The world is a wonderful place, and Christmas is a truly touching time of the year regardless of your religious persuasions. But not because of Santa. It is because of you. It is you who govern your own fate. It is you who help people on your own merit.

Whether you work or you provide employment, whether you donate or help out, it is you who are constantly making the world a better place. You donâ€™t need a communist Santa, you donâ€™t need a communist utopia. This is reality.

Stop believing in communism and start working for the benefit of free market.

18/12/2021, 5:25 pm - +91 90165 38357: had a problem with me laughing at the stupid questions, and accussed me of talking to ppl, like wtf? Cant even laugh at the stupid questions anymore? Before I begin my actual comment, I would like to apologize in advance for my inadequate level of English proficiency. I am not a native speaker of the world's current lingua franca which unfortunately leads to me making numerous embarrassing mistakes being made whenever I attempt to communicate using this language. Whenever I am reminded of how I lack the ability to convey my thoughts in an eloquent manner I feel as though I have committed a cardinal sin, as though every English teacher in the world are simultaneously shaking their heads and sighing due to how utterly disappointed they are at me.

Although I know that saying sorry to those of you who are reading my comment will not change the fact that I fail miserably to write and speak perfect English, I am writing this as a way to deter a certain type of people who cannot stand poor English (Also known informally as "Grammar Nazis") from mocking me by posting unwanted and unnecessary comments detailing my every blunder. In my humble opinion, making grammatical errors should be perfectly acceptable as native speakers should not expect non-native speakers to be able to communicate in their second or third languages eloquently. If you are able to completely understand what the other person wrote, is there really a problem with what they've written? No, because the entire concept of communication is the exchange of information between other intelligent beings, which means that no matter how the exchange of information is made, as long as the information is accurately shared there is not a fundamental issue with their ability to communicate. To see it in another way, remember that someone who isn't fluent in English is fluent in another language. When you think about it this way, isn't it impressive for someone to speak a second language in any capacity? Having empathy and respect are qualities that are sorely missing for far too many people these days, especially on the internet.

That being said, I am aware that not all netizens who correct others are doing it to ridicule and shame. There are some who do so with the intent to help others improve and grow. However, displaying the failures of other people publicly will cause the person who is criticized to feel negative emotions such as shame and sadness due to the fact that their mistake has been made obvious which severely undermines the point they were trying to make in spite of their unfamiliarity with the English language. In most circumstances people are not looking for language help when they post anything online. Most people just want to enjoy themselves and have a good time on the internet which is why I would not encourage correcting other people regardless of your intentions. If you really do want to help others with their spelling or grammar, I would highly recommend you to help via messaging privately because not only will you not embarrass anyone, you can also go more in-depth with your explanation which I'm sure the other person will greatly appreciate if they want help, but I digress. I know that I've written a bit of an essay, but I hope I've made my points clear. Anyways, here is the comment I wanted to make:

Our invig. was effed up man.

Dear Student,
Greetings from All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE), Ministry of Education..
To propel Indian Technical Education towards global standards and excel in the employability skills of technical students aligned with the New India vision of Shri Narendra Modi Ji, Honâ€™ble Prime Minister of India, various quality initiatives were taken by AICTE. Revision of curriculum and Mandatory 6 monthsâ€™ internships for industrial exposure to students are among the initiatives.
AICTE has mandated six-month internships as a part of Model curriculum for technical institutions. AICTE Internship policy mandates a minimum of 14-20 credits of Internship activities for B. Tech. degree programmes and 10-14 credits for three-year diploma programme. This will result in about 600 to 700 hours of total internship duration for B.Tech. and 450-500 hours for Diploma students.
In this regard, it is to inform that AICTE has launched Internship Portal https://internship.aicte-india.org/ to integrate classroom knowledge and theory with practical application and skills developed in professional or community settings. This website provides the perfect platform for students to put forth their skills & desires and for companies to place the intern demand. For more awareness about the internship opportunities available through AICTE internship is required.

1.	Students can greatly improve their CV and employment prospects by achieving this internationally recognized certification.
2.	In a world of â€œsurvival of the fittestâ€, students who focus on up-skilling, will have a distinct advantage for internships and placements.

4.	It is a proven fact that Certified Green Belts enjoy higher visibility in the eyes of senior management and fast track growth in career & emoluments.

You are requested to kindly cooperate by selecting one of the following 3 options, and informing us by THURSDAY, 30th Dec 2021: 

1.       Inform the date of your visit to the campus to vacate the hostel (note your visit should be before 10th January 2022)

12/01/2022, 7:11 pm - +91 98869 91112: Amrita University has recently established an Honorary Doctorate degree initiative, to honor the worldâ€™s leading scientists, academics, and public servants, for their contributions to humanity.
*The Honorary Doctorate ceremony will be held virtually on January 12th, 2022 from 8:15 pm to 10:00 pm IST.*
Join via Zoom. Visit amrita.link/honoraryphd

We are very pleased to inform you that Jeffrey D. Sachs, Global Economist for Sustainable Development, and Kailash Satyarthi, Nobel Peace Prize recipient, will be awarded Honorary Doctorates in the first event of its kind at Amrita University.

Jeffrey D. Sachs is a world leader in the field of Sustainable Development and has been instrumental in helping such a field get recognition through his tireless work around the world. He spearheaded its formation and spread in the academic world by creating a multi-disciplinary and multi-level view of what was then a new area. In addition, his broad and deep knowledge of economics and allied fields allowed him to convince the United Nations and major international NGOs to join the effort to make our world a better place for future generations of the worldâ€™s children.

Nobel Peace Laureate Kailash Satyarthi is widely known across the globe for his tireless efforts on child protection. He has been at the forefront of the global movement to end child slavery and exploitation since 1980. Through his â€œSave Childhood Movementâ€ (Bachpan Bachao Andolan), he liberated more than 86,000 children in India from child labor, slavery, and trafficking. He developed a successful model for their education, rehabilitation, and reintegration into mainstream society. His mission to create a child-friendly world resulted in hundreds of â€œchild-friendly villagesâ€ or Bal Mitra Grams (BMGs) in India and Nepal.

20/01/2022, 10:58 am - +91 98869 91112: Dear ALL,

InfyTQ is a challenging Certification more so for the non CSE students. As a faculty who was involved in teaching InfyTQ Python Fundamentals I know that you must prepare seriously if you aim to clear it. InfyTQ Exam is usually in the last week of February. You have to prepare on all the 4 modules of which Python and RDBMS will have more weightage. You have practice as there is a time limit for the questions. The Qualifier round is MCQ based but the final has both MCQ & Coding Questions. You have to score over 65% to 
clear it.

The 4 modules of InfyTQ are :

Python Fundamentals (or) Java Fundamentals
OOP using Python or Java
DSA using Python or Java
RDBMS

Please find attached PPT on details about InfyTQ Certification. 

Here are some links to InfyTQ Class Lectures

*InfyTQ Python Fundamentals Video Recordings*

https://drive.google.com/drive/u/1/folders/13wAmwQRjhGspX62tRpqdnn6uaouttS6f

*InfyTQ RDBMS Sessions*

https://drive.google.com/drive/u/1/folders/1JO3I7gBUSQGb1rEMEGikxZEUs8lDG050

*InfyTQ OOP*

Will get you the links

*InfyTQ DSA*

Will get you the links.

Wish you all the best.

Kind Regards,
Bhaskaran

27/01/2022, 4:41 pm - +91 98869 91112: Dear All,
 
Greetings and our Best wishes for the New Year 2022.

The International Day of Commemoration in Memory of the Victims of the Holocaust as designated by the UN General Assembly is held annually on 27 January â€“ As such, it would be commemorated by the Consulate General of Israel in Bengaluru.

The day of anniversary was chosen as it marks the liberation of the Auschwitz death camp, in which the International community joins in memory of the victims of the Holocaust.

The Holocaust was a turning point in history, which prompted the world to say "never again". The significance of respected UNGA resolution is that it calls for a remembrance of past crimes with an eye towards preventing them in the future.

Due to the Covid-19 situation, the ceremony will be held Virtually and take place on January 27th, 5:30pm-6:00pm.

Kindly find below the registration link for attendees.

https://us06web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_8Am4nwAaQA-1jC_ZROsizA  
 

Best regards,

Jonathan Zadka        

 
Jonathan Zadka
Consul General
Consulate General of Israel
to south India
)Based in Bengaluru)

(Refer the below link for more details:  https://www.75suryanamaskar.com/)

Suryanamaskar is a combination of poses, done with rhythmic breathing and chanting Mantras. Besides being a great cardiovascular workout, Suryanamaskar is also known to have an immensely positive impact on the body, mind and intellect.

Interested students and staff can register. The registration link is active now:
https://forms.office.com/r/iEU1f45EzA

Upload your daily practicing video in the below link: 
https://bit.ly/3uiuV06

The video should be less than 1 minute & Name the video's in the following format:
Name_date (e.g.- Pavan_30/01/22) 

Entries are welcome from 30th January - before 19th February.

All staff, UG, PG, and Ph.D. students are encouraged.

For more details, contact Mr. Pavan Kumar S N (Mobile no - 8147045146)

Thank you very much.

*_Your network is your net worth_*

It's built on the simple but effective premise of professional networking, making it the perfect place to reach professionals of all ages and backgrounds all over the world.

Amrita Center for International Programs (ACIP) invites applications from top performing students for SUMMER PROGRAMS at various universities abroad.
 
The students have to submit their interest to the Amrita Center for International Programs ASAP. Restricted number of students are accepted in these universities. Please go through the respective websites of the universities to see if relevant programs in your area of study are available. Bachelor students must have completed at least two years of their educational program at Amrita, with above average grades.
 
* Please note that the universities below have a specific field mentioned - it means that only those fields are available for the summer program, if nothing is specified, any discipline of education available in the university is open for summer program students.  
 
* Credits from ONLY PARTNER UNIVERSITIES can be transferred if it is mapped & approved by the HOD. Credits from non-partner universities cannot be transferred.
 
* In order to participate in the summer programs, the students are requested to get prior approval from their respective HODs as the dates might clash with your academics.

Presenting to you, the fourth session of the Tech Talk Series by Amrita Alumnus organised by Amrita school of Engineering, Bengaluru on "Practical guide to the world of quality assurance"

What is Quality Assurance and how is it different from other roles such as SDE?

This is a question that often ponders in many of our minds and to answer that and so many more, we have Aswathi Krishnan, a senior test engineer at Coosto, The Netherlands.

She is extremely passionate about quality assurance and is experienced in training and onboarding test engineers, test strategy and management as well as functional and test automation in web and mobile. She will be guiding us through this massive sea of quality assurance and will take us through the skillsets, job roles offered, types of testing tools, and the testimonials of QA engineers from various domains.

Date: 18-02-2022
Time: 16:00 - 17:00

18/02/2022, 8:41 am - +91 98869 91112: Greetings of the Day!

Presenting to you, the fifth session of the Tech Talk Series by Amrita Alumnus organised by Amrita school of Engineering, Bengaluru on "Supply Chain Management in the Age of Disruption"

Supply chain management blends analytical thinking with actionable activities and helps both businesses and customers when it is done correctly. There are varying degrees of severity and complexity in supply chain challenges, just as there are many proper solutions to tackle supply chain difficulties.

Ms. Kaushika GP, our speaker, is a Senior Analyst with Beroe Consulting's Logistics and Warehousing division in Chennai. She graduated from Amrita University in 2013 with a degree in Mechanical Engineering. During her tenure at L&T, she was responsible for project managing accommodation systems and general arrangement systems for the various warship projects undertaken by L&T.

Date: 18-02-2022
Time: 17:00 - 18:00

18/02/2022, 4:14 pm - +91 98869 91112: Namah Shivaya,

Campus France  will be conducting a virtual presentation for our students and faculty to help them understand the various educational and scholarship opportunities in France on 23rd February (Wednesday).

About Campus France (https://www.inde.campusfrance.org/): Campus France is an organization under the French Institute in India which is the cultural wing under the French Embassy in Delhi and we provide services related to higher educational opportunities in France. Their office in Chennai covers promotions throughout Tamil Nadu and Pondicherry and are currently based out of the Branch office of the French Consulate in Chennai. Part of their services at Campus France involves helping students find relevant academic opportunities in France as well as fostering academic collaborations between Indian and French Institutions. Students equally have to go through their services to apply for student visas.

The following is the registration link . Please circulate to all 3rd and final year engineering students.
Registration link:      https://forms.gle/d568xTEQKtoHQVos9

Please note that this session is open for students as well as faculty members. The zoom link for the session will directly be sent to all the students / faculty members who have registered on the above link up till one day before the event.

Presenting to you, the sixth session of the Tech Talk Series by Amrita Alumnus organised by Amrita school of Engineering, Bengaluru on "Safe and Robust Self Driving Technology"

How does the technology behind self driving cars work? How do we know that it's safe?

Many of us would have had this question in our minds. Well, not anymore!

Kailash Nagarajan, Associate Engineer at the Intelligent Control Systems Team at Siemens India, is here to put all our queries to rest. Kailash loves control theory for Robotics and also interned at IIIT Hyderabad in the Robotics Research Center division.

Join us on 19th February (Saturday) as Kailash takes us through the world of Safe and Robust Self Driving Technology!

â€‹INTERNATIONAL SUMMER PROGRAMS - 2022
Amrita Center for International Programs (ACIP) invites applications from top performing students for SUMMER PROGRAMS at various universities abroad.
 
The students have to submit their interest to the Amrita Center for International Programs ASAP. Restricted number of students are accepted in these universities. Please go through the respective websites of the universities to see if relevant programs in your area of study are available. Bachelor students must have completed at least two years of their educational program at Amrita, with above average grades.
 
* Please note that the universities below have a specific field mentioned - it means that only those fields are available for the summer program, if nothing is specified, any discipline of education available in the university is open for summer program students.  
 
* Credits from ONLY PARTNER UNIVERSITIES can be transferred if it is mapped & approved by the HOD. Credits from non-partner universities cannot be transferred.
 
* In order to participate in the summer programs, the students are requested to get prior approval from their respective HODs as the dates might clash with your academics.

07/04/2022, 11:46 pm - +91 90165 38357: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is the code that styles web content.
With CSS, you can control the color, font, the size of text, 
the spacing between elements, how elements are positioned and laid out, 
what background images or background colors are to be used, 
different displays for different devices and screen sizes, and much more!

We'll answer questions like: How do I make text red? 
How do I make content display at a certain location in the (webpage) layout? 
How do I decorate my webpage with background images and colors?

Date: 8th April 2022
Time: 15:40-16:15 (IST)
Venue: Computer Lab 1, 5th floor E block

Agenda:
1. Why do we need CSS
2. Selectors ( types of CSS)
3. Fonts, Colours, Padding, Background, Margins
4. Tables, Box Model
5. Q & A Session

09/05/2022, 6:48 pm - +91 81093 01182: *RECRUITMENT ALERT FROM TEAM ROVER_ASEB* 

*SOMETIMES, IT IS ROCKET SCIENCE!* 
Did the Mars Rover pique your curiosity to explore further into the hidden depths of our Universe? Did you ever dream of making your own Rover?  
If yes, then here's a chance for all the space enthusiasts, robotic developers and science freaks from all branches to use their skills to gain a hands-on experience in building a Rover and to explore and experiment in fields far beyond their imagination. The main aim of this project is to compete with Rovers from across the globe in a Martian based environment at events like IRC, URC and ERC.
